alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Heard (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:15PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Heard and Coweta Counties through 545 PM EST... At 514 PM EST, a strong thunderstorm was over Powers Crossroads, or 8 miles east of Franklin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Newnan, Senoia, Grantville, Moreland, Sharpsburg, Turin, East Newnan, Corinth, Arnco-Sargent, Powers Crossroads, Handy, Cannongate, Plant Wansley, Thomas Crossroads and Madras. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for northwestern and west central Georgia.
